skills.name: Complete mental addition problems up to 1000
Complete mental subtraction problems up to 1000
Carry out mental divisions when the answer is an integer
Read an integer on a scale where the required measurement is marked by a number
Mental multiplication and the laws of arithmetic

explanations.A: You have added the values together but we need to find the difference between them...
explanations.B: You have divided 550 by 110 but we need to find the difference between them...
explanations.C: To find how much more flour is needed we do 550 - 110 = 440 therefore we need 440g more flour.
explanations.D: You need to read the weighing scales... We already have 110g of flour so to get 550g how much more do we need?

explanations.A: You have added the values together but "how much more" means we need to find the difference between them...
explanations.B: Almost, but double check your calculation. 550g more would take us to 780g.
explanations.C: You need to read the weighing scales... We already have 230g of flour so to get 680g how much more do we need?
explanations.D: To find how much more flour is needed we do 680 - 230 = 450 therefore we need 450g more flour.

explanations.A: To find the mass after the yeast is added we do 35 + 7 = 42 therefore the mass will be 42g.
explanations.B: I think you have subtracted but to the find the total mass of the flour and yeast, you need to add...
explanations.C: I think you have divided but to the find the total mass of the flour and yeast, you need to add...
explanations.D: Make sure you read the scales... There is 35g of flour then we add 7g of yeast, so how many grams is that altogether?

explanations.A: I think you have subtracted but to the find the total mass of the flour and yeast, you need to add...
explanations.B: To find the mass after the yeast is added we do 65 + 8 = 73 therefore the mass will be 73g.
explanations.C: Make sure you read the scales... There is 65g of flour then we add 8g of yeast, so how many grams is that altogether?
explanations.D: Careful, I think you have tried to add the flour and yeast, but check the place value - it looks like you added 8 to the tens instead of the ones.

explanations.A: This is the volume of 1 jug but we have 8 jugs in total...
explanations.B: I think you have done 8 รท 2 but we have 8 jugs of 2 litres so we need to multiply...
explanations.C: I think you have added the 8 and 2 but we have 8 jugs of 2 litres so we need to multiply...
explanations.D: Each jug is 2 litres and we have 8 jugs so we do 8 x 2 = 16 therefore there is 16 litres of juice altogether!

explanations.A: This is the volume of 1 jug but we have 5 jugs in total...
explanations.B: I think you have done 2 รท 5 but we have 5 jugs of 2 litres so we need to multiply...
explanations.C: I think you have added the 5 and 2 but we have 5 jugs of 2 litres so we need to multiply...
explanations.D: Each jug is 2 litres and we have 5 jugs so we do 5 x 2 = 10, therefore there are 10 litres of juice altogether.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied, but we are sharing out the sugar so we need to divide...
explanations.B: I think you have added, but we are sharing out the sugar so we need to divide...
explanations.C: To find out how much sugar is in each cake, we do 80 รท 4 = 20 therefore there is 20g!
explanations.D: I think you have subtracted but we are sharing out the sugar, so we need to divide...

explanations.A: To find out how much sugar is in each cake, we do 100 รท 4 = 25 therefore there is 25g!
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied, but we are sharing out the sugar so we need to divide...
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted but we are sharing out the sugar, so we need to divide...
explanations.D: I think you have added, but we are sharing out the sugar so we need to divide...

explanations.A: This is the current mass of flour but the question wants us to add another 150g of flour and say what the mass would be then...
explanations.B: I think you have subtracted 150g from 400g but we're adding more flour so we need to add the value on...
explanations.C: Make sure you read the scales as we already have some flour.. Can you see how much? If we add 150g more what will we have in total?
explanations.D: There is currently 400g of flour, if we add 150g more that's 400 + 150 = 550 therefore a mass of 550g would be shown!

explanations.A: Make sure you read the scales as we already have some flour.. Can you see how much? If we add 250g more what will we have in total?
explanations.B: This is the current mass of flour but the question wants us to add another 250g of flour and say what the mass would be then...
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted 200g from 250g but we're adding more flour so we need to add the value on...
explanations.D: There is currently 200g of flour, if we add 250g more that's 200 + 250 = 450 therefore a mass of 450g would be shown!
